activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:54 AM Defendant Karisina SM Schneider in court.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel in court for Karisina SM Schneider.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
Attorney Hoel recites agreement.  
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. 
State moves to remove repeater enhancer. Court grants amendment. 
Guilty plea entered to Count 1. 

Court relates and orders PSI. 
Bond to continue.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney fee $1,080.00
Plea hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Barron Co added as other party for purposes of collection of attorney fees.
Order for Payment - Attorney fees $1,080.00
Affidavit and Attorney Invoice
Final pre-trial on October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 20, 2022 at 08:00 am.

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Karisina SM Schneider in court.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Karisina SM Schneider.
Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Attorney Hoel relates.  State relates.  JT 10/20/22 - Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 10/18/22.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Karisina SM Schneider appeared by video and phone.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Karisina SM Schneider.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court questions Defendant. Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Defendant must appear in person for next hearing. Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed.  Repay $50.00 per month starting 04/01/2022.
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:37 AM Prosecuting attorney Julie L Matucheski appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Karisina SM Schneider appeared by video, Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Karisina SM Schneider.
Waive reading and time limits for preliminary hearing.  Next hearing to be in person if Defendant does not have a good zoom connection.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Attorney fees.  Laura Sutton appointed. Repay $50.00 per month starting 04/01/2022.
and Order.  Granted.  Laura Sutton appointed.  repay $50.00 per month starting 04/01/2022.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Julie L Matucheski appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Karisina SM Schneider appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew Knaak appears for defendant by video for today.

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility today before leaving jail.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.
